I just wanted to say that it is great that someone takes the time to generate sub-titles in any language for a movie. I do however, think that hard-burning the sub-titles into the movie is not the best thing to do. If sub-titles are included in the torrent as sub-title files (such as text srt files), then someone else that knows the language can also translate it into another language to help more people. If English speakers want to watch the video without the sub-titles, then the included sub-title file(s) do not have to be used and the movie can be viewed without sub-titles.
I am just making a suggestion which benefits everyone.  
Thanks uploader.  Peace !!

NLUPPER002, Could you please UL "Act of Valor"?  The only one I found so far was all rar files.

Re files over 2GB. Some people (like me) prefer the large file as they are usually ready to burn to a DVD and need no conversion.  I don't watch movies on my PC, I like to sit in my recliner and enjoy the full effect with good sound on a big screen.  I do think hardcoded subs are a problem if they are in a language other than English, which is only good if it's a movie in some language other than English.

Thanks to all who upload your effort is most appreciated.
